td.content: s:male aged 51 years presents with mild vomiting. he also reports moderate nausea, severe headache, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the mild vomiting. a short time ago he sustained a blow to the back of the head (LOC 55 min) o:Height 174 cm, Weight 86.1 kg, Temperature 36.8 C, Pulse 74, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 19, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:51 yr old male concierge presents for recheck following traumatic incident. he was seen in local EMD for injuries, including a concussion (55 min LOC). he reports doing fine with no problems and denies vomiting, nausea and headache describes drinking an average of 12 drinks a week for about 7 days in his past he does not smoke o:Height 174 cm, Weight 85.5 kg, Temperature 36.8 C, Pulse 74, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 18, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=96,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=44,Reaction Time=0.48, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: presents for recheck following traumatic incident
his past he does not smoke
